001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.core.utils;
002
003import java.io.File;
004import java.io.IOException;
005import java.nio.file.Files;
006import java.nio.file.Path;
007import java.nio.file.Paths;
008import java.nio.file.StandardCopyOption;
009import java.util.Comparator;
010import java.util.stream.Stream;
011
012/**
013 * Utility-class that invokes standard JDK utilities, but wraps {@link java.io.IOException}
014 * into {@link IllegalStateException} and creates missing parent directories.
015 */
016public class CoreFileUtils {
017
018    /**
019     * The same as {@link #loadFileContent(File)}, but accept the path to that file as {@link String}
020     *
021     * @param pathToLoadStr the path of file to laod as {@link String}
022     * @return the content of that file as {@link String} or {@code null} if it's impossible to do
023     */
024    public static String loadFileContent(String pathToLoadStr) {
025        return loadFileContent(Paths.get(pathToLoadStr).toFile());
026    }
027
028    /**
029     * Loading the content of {@code file} as {@link String} (it's better to use for text-files only)
030     * and returning {@code null} if the content of file could not be loaded for any reason.
031     *
032     * @param fileToLoad file to read the content
033     * @return the content of {@code file} as {@link String} or {@code null} if it's impossible to do
034     */
035    public static String loadFileContent(File fileToLoad) {
036        if (fileToLoad == null || !fileToLoad.isFile()) {
037            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
038                "could not load the file %s because it does not exist or it's not a normal file",
039                fileToLoad == null ? "<< NULL >>" : "'" + fileToLoad + "'"));
040        }
041        try {
042            return Files.readString(fileToLoad.toPath());
043        } catch (IOException ignored) {
044            return null;
045        }
046    }
047
048    /**
049     * Saving the content into the file {@code fileToSave} (if the file is not empty - it will be truncated).
050     * All missing parent directories will be created if necessary.
051     *
052     * @param fileToSave the file to save into
053     * @param fileContent the content to be saved
054     * @throws IllegalStateException in case of something goes wrong (which must not really happen)
055     */
056    public static void saveFileContent(File fileToSave, String fileContent) {
057        if (fileToSave == null) {
058            throw new IllegalStateException(
059                "could not save the file content, because fileToSave is null");
060        }
061        try {
062            if (fileToSave.getParentFile() != null) {
063                Files.createDirectories(fileToSave.getParentFile().toPath());
064            }
065            Files.writeString(fileToSave.toPath(), fileContent);
066        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
067            throw new IllegalStateException("could not save the content into the file " + fileToSave, ioEx);
068        }
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * Copy the file {@code sourceFile} to the file {@code targetFile}
073     * and creates all missing parent directories if necessary.
074     */
075    public static void copyFile(File sourceFile, File targetFile) {
076        if (sourceFile == null || !sourceFile.isFile()) {
077            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
078                "could not copy the file %s because it's not a normal file",
079                sourceFile == null ? "<< NULL >>" : "'" + sourceFile + "'"));
080        }
081        if (targetFile == null) {
082            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
083                "could not copy the file '%s' because target file is null", sourceFile));
084        }
085        try {
086            if (targetFile.getParentFile() != null) {
087                Files.createDirectories(targetFile.getParentFile().toPath());
088            }
089            Files.copy(sourceFile.toPath(), targetFile.toPath(), StandardCopyOption.REPLACE_EXISTING);
090        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
091            throw new IllegalStateException(String.format(
092                "could not copy the file '%s' into '%s' because of IOException",
093                sourceFile, targetFile), ioEx);
094        }
095    }
096
097    /**
098     * The same as {@link Files#deleteIfExists(Path)}, but ignore any kind of {@link IOException}.
099     * <hr/>
100     * <u><i>Note:</i></u> For non-empty directory the method {@link #removeSilent(File)} should be used,
101     * because this method will always return {@code false} for non-empty directory and remove nothing.
102     *
103     * @param pathToRemove the path to either a file or an empty directory to remove
104     * @return {@code true} if the item (file or empty directory) is removed, or {@code false} otherwise
105     */
106    public static boolean removePathSilent(Path pathToRemove) {
107        if (pathToRemove == null) {
108            return false;
109        }
110        try {
111            return Files.deleteIfExists(pathToRemove);
112        } catch (IOException ignored) {
113            return false;
114        }
115    }
116
117    /**
118     * Recursively removes either a single file or the whole directory and returns the number of removed items
119     *
120     * @param fileOrDirToRemove path to either a file or a directory to remove recursively
121     * @return the number of removed items
122     */
123    public static int removeSilent(File fileOrDirToRemove) {
124        if (fileOrDirToRemove == null) {
125            return -1;
126        }
127        if (!fileOrDirToRemove.exists()) {
128            return 0;
129        }
130        try {
131            if (fileOrDirToRemove.isFile()) {
132                return fileOrDirToRemove.delete() ? 1 : 0;
133            }
134            try (Stream<Path> walkPathStream = Files.walk(fileOrDirToRemove.toPath())) {
135                return (int) walkPathStream.sorted(Comparator.reverseOrder()) // Sort in reverse order to delete contents before directories
136                    .filter(CoreFileUtils::removePathSilent)
137                    .count();
138            }
139        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
140            return -2;
141        }
142    }
143}
